parameters: \n<Claire> Oh, sorry there, don't mind me.
I am just training so that one day I will
be able to participate in the Alphea
\n<Cedric> Oh okay. What's the Alphea tournament?
\n<Claire> The Alphea tournament is held every year
where people compete for the title of The
Undefeated. You see having that title in
Luthania means a lot. I have always wanted
\n<Claire> to compete but have always been told that I
wouldn't stand a chance if I were to enter
the Alphea tournament. But I believe that
if I keep training one day I'd be good
\n<Cedric> Yes, I am sure you could do great if you
\n<Claire> Here's a thought, why don't you test me?
\n<Claire> Thankyou so much. Just dont go easy on me.
\n<Claire> Oh thats ashame I could really use your help.
\n<Cyril> Would you like to buy something?
Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and

picture to slide in the emotes

You're foolish for coming here! The King has started locking people up - \|\|\^
- for no reason. No one is safe in this city. He even had his own son - \|\|\^
- the Prince sent to the dungeons along with his fianc. \|\|\^
Slide the picture back to the right a little, and set opacity to 0.
We're going to be doing this for every emote! Make sure to wait 20 frames
before the next dialogue or the pictures will insta-change rather than
The Lady Idelle I believe she is called. \|\|\^
Do you know where I can find Lady Idelle? \|\|\^
In the dungeons like I said. May I ask why you want to know? \|\|\^
Shes my sister. I am Lord Cedric of Haffenden. \|\|\^
You say it so proudly, its a shame your title doesn't mean anything in - \|\|\^
- Luthania. Well been that they are your family I should let you know - \|\|\^
Yes, well the King had her executed, the reason is still unclear though. \|\|\^
I dont believe you. My mother cant be dead. They should have never come here. \|\|\^
I havent finished your sister the younger one Lady Leya has been missing - \|\|\^
- since the whole problem started. She might be dead too. \|\|\^
Leya is gone as well?! I swear my family is falling apart. Okay boy is - \|\|\^
- is there a way to enter the castle? That bastard is going to pay for this. \|\|\^
Youre really going to stop him? \|\|\^
It seems to be the only way to free my sister. \|\|\^
Well in that case you wont be able to access the castle through the main - \|\|\^
- gates there blocked off, orders of the King. However, there is a secret - \|\|\^
- cave that can get you into the castle. You can access it through the - \|\|\^

\n<Emeline> They will never find her. She is dead.
\n<Emeline> The young Lady Leya. The girl that went
missing when the King started acting up. I
don't believe she's alive. The guards
probably killed her and did away with her.
\n<Emeline> If she survived then she is no longer in
\n<Cedric> I just don't understand how someone can go
missing like that. I'm still trying to wrap
\n<Emeline> Well there's always someone or something
\n<Emeline> Its a pleasure sharing ideas with you.
\n<Cedric>Hello Emeline, I am here to inform you of a
'get togehter' that Ivory Tumour is holding.
\n<Emeline>Ooh a party does sound nice. I'd love to go.
\n<Art> I believe it was stress that turned him crazy.
He had to look after an entire kingdom and
not just any kingdom Luthania. Its the biggest
\n<Cedric> Are you on about the King?
\n<Art> Yes I am I'm trying to figure out what could
have caused him to turn crazy all of a sudden.
\n<Cedric> Well maybe he was ill if he was perfectly
normal before maybe an illness took him.
\n<Art> I will find out what it was.
\n<Orlena> My Lord, I have to say King Dormatos
marriage to the now Queen Idelle is
wonderful isn't it. They are one adorable
couple, I cant imagine a better match.
\n<Cedric> I guess they do suit each other. It was a
\n<Orlena> I guess my Lord? They were locked in
dungeons for weeks, they must have bonded
down there if you know what I mean. Young
love is certainly something. I remember
\n<Orlena> when I was starting out, oops I digress. I

\n<Edan Darroll>Maybe you can help me with it? There's this
girl Ley Daena who I love. I need you to
convince her to fall for me.
\n<Cedric>Well Edan Darroll sent me to let you know
that he is deeply interested in you.
\n<Lee Daena>He is? I've been eyeing him up for months I
guess I should go see him.
\n<Lee Daena>Hello dear, how can I help?
\n<Cedric>Well I came to let you know that Ivory
Tumour wants to invite you to a party she
\n<Lee Daena>Oh a party? I'd love to attend.
\n<Lorica Colleville>With the war going on, we have refugees
pouring into Luthania. Do you think you
could help a few settle in?
\n<Lorica Colleville>Great, heres what to do first. Find the
refugees around the city and bring them to
\n<Lorica Colleville>Great, now you need to sort out clothes for
them. The market should be the best place.
\n<Lorica Colleville>I see you sorted clothes out. Lastly I need
you to sort out food for them aswell.
\n<Lorica Colleville>Thankyou for helping out. You've made a
\n<Lorica Colleville>We have to do our part for the community.
\n<Cedric>Thats all the refugees in the area
currently. I should go see Lorica

\n<Ivory Tumour>Yes thankyou so much you will be rewarded

\n<Cedric>Thankyou, it's an honour to hear someone

I need you to help protect the area.

\n<Cedric>Oh erm, I am looking for clothes for some

\n<Windy Bouchard>Refugees you say? Well I have some clothes
that are no longer being sold I was going
to throw them away. The embroidery was a
little off. You can take them. I'm sure the
refugees won't care for the pattern.
